B2 [ before noun ] special, or this and not any other: She wanted a particular type of cactus. He wouldn't take just any book - he had to have this particular one! "Why did you ask?" "Oh, no particular reason, just making conversation." in particular
B1 especially: What in particular did you like about the last apartment that we saw?

particular adjective
(NOT EASILY SATISFIED)
C1 [ after verb ] not easily satisfied and demanding that close attention should be given to every detail: He's very particular about the kitchen - everything has to be perfectly clean and in its place. She's very particular about what she eats.

See more the particular formal
